title: Recent homes sales in Greater Boston (Sept. 10)
author: The Boston Globe
bullets: Abington saw home sales like 27 Camp St, a 4-bed Cape Cod, sold for $710,000 on a 26,988 sq ft lot.
Acton recorded sales including 123 Skyline Drive, a 2-bed condo town house sold for $860,000, built in 2016.
In Andover, a one-family antique at 58 Abbot St sold for $2,825,000, featuring 4 bedrooms and 5 baths.

title: Here’s who will be on the ballot for November’s 2025 City Council election
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Candidates for Boston's 2025 City Council election were finalized after the preliminary round on September 9.
Ruthzee Louijeune leads the at-large city councilor race, with Julia M. Mejia closely following in second.
Incumbent Gabriela Coletta Zapata captured 76.96% of votes in District 1, dominating ahead of challengers.

title: Mayoral preliminary: Wu maintains huge lead over Kraft as both advance to November election
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Boston Mayor Michelle Wu leads the preliminary mayoral election, with a 45-point advantage over challenger Josh Kraft.
Josh Kraft vows to continue his campaign after trailing Wu by about 26,400 votes in preliminary results.
The preliminary election saw nearly 18% voter turnout, with over 75,000 ballots cast according to Boston Elections Department.

title: What to know about the viral surrogacy lawsuit
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: Cindy Bi, a San Francisco venture capitalist, sued surrogate Rebecca Smith, claiming she killed the fetus after a miscarriage.
Surrogacy industry growth outpaces regulations; experts warn about increased pregnancy risks when fetus is non-genetically related.
Smith moved and changed jobs to avoid harassment from Bi, who allegedly contacted Smith's employer and spread false claims.

title: A healthy Hampus Lindholm could change Bruins’ fortunes in several areas
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Hampus Lindholm returns to Bruins' training camp fully healthy after missing 65 games with a fractured patella.
Lindholm aims to revitalize Bruins' defense and power play, which ranked 29th with a 15.2% success rate last season.
Lindholm's past success with David Pastrnak shows potential to boost Bruins' offensive production this NHL season.

title: Drake Maye receives a ringing endorsement from Bills QB Josh Allen
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Josh Allen praised Patriots QB Drake Maye, calling him "an unbelievable kid" and "one of my favorite young quarterbacks."
Drake Maye completed 30-of-46 passes for 287 yards, 1 touchdown, and 1 interception in a loss to the Raiders.
Maye, compared to Josh Allen due to his playing style, was picked third overall in the 2024 NFL Draft.

title: MBTA debuts train design to honor historic New England railroad, with more on the way
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: MBTA unveils a train with Boston and Maine Railroad's maroon and yellow design to honor historic New England lines.
Two more trains with historic designs, New Haven Railroad and New York Central Railroad, to debut by year's end.
Refurbished trains, originally from 1987-1991, feature upgrades like remote monitoring, cameras, and modern brake systems.

title: Patriots could be facing off against their former 1st-round pick in Miami
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Former Patriots lineman Cole Strange joins Miami Dolphins from Cleveland Browns' practice squad before facing New England.
Strange, a 2022 first-round pick, struggled with injuries and was released by Patriots after three seasons.
Miami signed Strange after losing right guard James Daniels to injury in Week 1 against the Colts.

title: Tufts to go tuition-free for families making less than $150K
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Tufts University will offer free tuition for undergraduate students from families earning less than $150,000 starting next fall.
Students from families earning under $60,000 will receive financial aid packages without student loans.
The policy is funded by donor contributions and aims to reduce the student loan burden and increase geographic diversity.

title: Aunt now caring for young daughter of parents killed in Watertown murder-suicide
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: David Minasvand killed Karine Asatryan and Nadia Abrahamian in a Watertown murder-suicide before turning the gun on himself.
The couple's 1-year-old daughter, Madeline, will be raised by her aunt following the deaths of her parents.
A fundraiser has raised over $37,000 to support Madeline's future, covering supplies, medical care, and education.
